column4: i recently did an update all through synaptic, and it broke my fglrx drivers. anyone know why or how to fix it?
i recently did an update all through synaptic, and it broke my fglrx drivers (they won't comple). anyone know why or how to fix it?
i'm pretty sure i did that though
you need to do what you once did all over again.
but what i did no longer works... i think trying to get the linux-restricted-module doesn't work, i can't find the package
well nvm, it found them today...
just make sure you have multiverse enabled.  also if you google "Seveas ubuntu" i think he has kernels already compiled with the ATI driver on his repos
i guess they just weren't released when i tried it yesterday... thanks for having me try it again!
you mean from Seveas repos ?  i saw something that looked like fglrx drivers from there.  or a kernel.  memory not great right now.
no, just in the multiverse
then perhaps you should check out the Seveas dapper repo :)  let me see if i have a link.  i lost all but have backups of -- life sustaining things.
lol
please browse this site http://seveas.theplayboymansion.net/seveas/dists/dapper-seveas/
how do i add that in synaptic?
let me cat my sources.list
are you registered so i can PM you ?
no =/
i have AIM at this sn though
Ok I don't get what I'm doing wrong...
it still won't compile right, but i have the headers and everything
how do i stop this error when installing fglrx: "[Message]  Kernel Module : Trying to install a precompiled kernel module."
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/16849
thanks
you will still need to refer to the original webpage i posted for the gpg key to access the repo.
